Key Match Events: Syria crushed India with a 3-0 victory, breaking their hearts with goals in the 7th, 77th minutes, and injury time.
Gurpreet Singh Sandhu thwarted several goal-bound moves from Syria in the first half.
Liston Colaco's long-range effort hit the horizontal in stoppage time.
Pablo David Sabbag tapped in the third goal for Syria in injury time.
Pre-Game Insights: Syria had beaten India 1-0 in the Asian Cup in Qatar in January this year.
India had won the Intercontinental Cup title in 2018 and 2023, while it was the first trophy for Syria.
Post-Match Reflections: The result meant that Manolo Marquez began his stint as India head coach on a disappointing note.
India had made a horrendous start in the match as they conceded a goal in the 7th minute.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was the first time Syria won a title on Indian soil.
Syria had finished third in 2019 Intercontinental Cup and lost back-to-back Nehru Cup finals to India in 2007 and 2009.
Others: India made some fine attacking moves in the second half but failed to get the desired result.
Manolo replaced Nikhil Poojary and Suresh Singh with Asish Rai and Apuia in the second half.
